subject: Art & Design
title: Streaming Wars: How Distribution Changed Cinema
description: One-minute skill: Streaming Wars: How Distribution Changed Cinema.

hook.text: Netflix spent $17 billion on content in a single year. More than most countries' entire film industries combined.

buildup.text: Streaming platforms disrupted the theatrical release model. Films now premiere on screens in your pocket.

discovery.text: The window between theater and home release shrank from months to days. Some films skip theaters entirely.

twist.text: Scorsese called Marvel films 'not cinema.' The debate about what counts as cinema intensified.

climax.text: International films found global audiences through streaming. Parasite's Oscar win was partly a streaming effect.

punchline.text: Cinema isn't dying. It's moving to a different screen.

quiz.question: How has streaming changed international cinema?
options: International films found global audiences they couldn't reach through theaters alone
Only Hollywood films are available on streaming
